member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Broker.DialogEndPointState
member.summary: The enumeration contains constant values that specify the state of the endpoint at the service.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Broker.DialogEndPointState.Open
member.summary: The dialog is open and communicating normally.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Broker.DialogEndPointState.OpenWait
member.summary: The endpoint has been created. It is waiting for a response from the opposite endpoint.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Broker.DialogEndPointState.Disabled
member.summary: The endpoint has been disabled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Broker.DialogEndPointState.ClosingWait
member.summary: The endpoint is closed and inoperable. It is waiting for the opposite endpoint to close.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Broker.DialogEndPointState.ErrorWait
member.summary: The endpoint has declared an error and is waiting for a response from the opposite endpoint.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Broker.DialogEndPointState.ClosedWait
member.summary: The endpoint is closed and is waiting for replay timeout to expire.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Broker.DialogType
member.summary: The enumeration contains constant values that specify the type of dialog between Service Broker endpoints.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Broker.DialogType.Regular2Way
member.summary: A regular two-way dialog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Broker.DialogType.MonologPublish
member.summary: Identified for informational purposes only. Not supported. Future compatibility is not guaranteed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Broker.DialogType.MonologReceive
member.summary: Identified for informational purposes only. Not supported. Future compatibility is not guaranteed.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Broker.MessageSource
member.summary: The enumeration contains constant values that specify which endpoint sent the message.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Broker.MessageSource.Initiator
member.summary: Specifies the message was sent by the dialog initiator endpoint.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Broker.MessageSource.Target
member.summary: Specifies the message was sent by the target endpoint.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Broker.MessageSource.InitiatorAndTarget
member.summary: Specifies the message was sent by either the initiator endpoint or the target endpoint.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Broker.MessageTypeValidation
member.summary: The enumeration contains constant values that specify the types of validation performed on the Service Broker message body.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Broker.MessageTypeValidation.None
member.summary: Validation is not performed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Broker.MessageTypeValidation.XmlSchemaCollection
member.summary: The message body must contain XML that passes validation by the XML schema collection specified for the message type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Broker.MessageTypeValidation.Empty
member.summary: The message body must be NULL for this message type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Broker.MessageTypeValidation.Xml
member.summary: The message body must contain well-formed XML data.
